Frances is a National Library of Medicine predoctoral fellow at Oregon Health & Science University. She has a M.S. in Bioscience & Health Policy and a B.S. in Biochemistry & Molecular Biology from Rice University. Frances is a former health policy intern at the Senate HELP Committee and a research assistant at the Pacific Northwest Evidence-based Practice Center. Her dissertation aims to discover and organize potential biases in electronic health record (EHR) data, and apply causal inference to improve research using EHR data.
